pr_title: CB-9374: Use last FreeIPA cookie when there are multiple

timeline.bodyText:
Lets add this comment block from the canonical freeipa client for reference

A cookie string may contain multiple cookies, parse the cookie
string and return the last cookie in the string matching the
cookie name or None if not found.
method which iterates over what parse() returns looking for
the specific cookie.
When cookie_name appears more than once the last instance is
returned rather than the first because the ordering sequence
makes the last instance the current value.
timeline.author: kmanamcheri

timeline.message:
CB-9374: Use last FreeIPA cookie when there are multiple

When there are multiple FreeIPA ipa_session cookies, use the last one.
This is the same behavior as FreeIPA does.
See https://github.com/freeipa/freeipa/blob/139d60d74706d2ba9855db5faefee322b23b0ba5/ipapython/cookie.py#L322-L349
for details.

timeline.bodyText: Don't you have to use it somewhere? Like when you are sorting above, you have to use this comparator, no?
timeline.author: kmanamcheri

replies.bodyText:
The FreeIpaCookeieStore is already sorted:

  
    
      cloudbreak/freeipa/src/main/java/com/sequenceiq/freeipa/util/FreeIpaCookieStore.java
    
    
         Line 15
      in
      865c9d0
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private final Set<Cookie> cookies = new TreeSet<>(new CookieComparator()); 
        
    
  


private final Set<Cookie> cookies = new TreeSet<>(new CookieComparator());
replies.author: jamisonbennett

replies.bodyText:
I see that this is already used in

      in
